graph.original_query: Create a responsive, professional single-page CV Builder using Tailwind CSS + Flowbite via CDN (no build tools) in pure HTML/CSS/JS, with a 3-column layout:Left column: dark background, vertical menu with icons and text (sections: Personal Information, Work Experience, Education, Skills, Certifications, Templates), a progress bar at top, an “Export as PDF” button and a “Reset Form” button at bottom.Center column: shows the active form section, styled with Flowbite components (cards, inputs, select, file upload), smooth transitions, consistent spacing, and minimalist borders/shadows.Right column: live CV Preview styled like a professional resume, with section-wise entries updating in real time based on user input; optimized for print/export and styled in white background with rich black text.Maintain a modern black-and-white theme, beautiful sans-serif font (e.g. DM Sans or Inter), clear headers, icons, spacing, and button styles.Make layout mobile/tablet responsive using Tailwind utilities.Ensure PDF export, form reset, and section navigation work with minimal JS.Call CoderAgent in 8–10 detailed steps: layout skeleton, Tailwind/Flowbite setup, left nav build, section forms, live preview, JS sync logic, PDF export, responsive tweaks, print styles, polish spacing + font sizing.Call CoderAgent at least 9–10 times to build this in parts, updating same HTML file each time with precise context.

T001.initial_thoughts: Let's create a basic HTML skeleton for the CV Builder. I will include the necessary meta tags for responsiveness and viewport settings, set the title to 'CV Builder', and add CDN links for Tailwind CSS and Flowbite. The structure will include a main container.

T002.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to update the index.html file to include a 3-column grid layout using Tailwind CSS. The layout should be responsive, adjusting for different screen sizes. I will use the grid classes and responsive prefixes to achieve this. I'll use the HTML content from the previous step as a starting point and modify the container div to create the grid. I will also wrap the existing content inside the middle column for now.

T003.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to update the `index.html` file by adding the vertical navigation menu, progress bar, and buttons in the left column. I'll use Flowbite's list group component for the menu items and include Font Awesome icons. I will also add a progress bar with a hardcoded 20% progress and 'Export as PDF' and 'Reset Form' buttons at the bottom of the column. I will use Tailwind CSS classes for styling and alignment. I'll update the existing HTML structure from the previous step.

T014.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to summarize the process of building the CV builder based on the provided HTML report. I will focus on the key steps, technologies used, and the overall architecture.

summary_bullets: The CV Builder is a responsive, single-page application built using HTML, CSS (Tailwind CSS + Flowbite), and JavaScript.
The application features a 3-column layout: a vertical menu on the left, interactive form sections in the center, and a live CV preview on the right.
Key technologies used include HTML for structure, Tailwind CSS and Flowbite for styling, and JavaScript for interactive features.
The left column provides navigation between sections like Personal Information, Work Experience, Education, Skills, and Templates.
The center column displays the active form section, styled with Flowbite components.
The right column offers a live CV preview that updates in real-time as the user inputs data.
The application is designed to be mobile and tablet responsive.
PDF export and form reset functionalities are implemented using JavaScript.

nodes.description: Create the basic HTML skeleton with necessary meta tags, title, and CDN links for Tailwind CSS and Flowbite.
nodes.agent_prompt: Create a basic HTML skeleton for a single-page application. Include the necessary meta tags for responsiveness and viewport settings. Set the title to 'CV Builder'. Include CDN links for Tailwind CSS and Flowbite. Add a basic structure with a main container.

output.initial_thoughts: Let's create a basic HTML skeleton for the CV Builder. I will include the necessary meta tags for responsiveness and viewport settings, set the title to 'CV Builder', and add CDN links for Tailwind CSS and Flowbite. The structure will include a main container.

nodes.description: Implement the 3-column layout using Tailwind CSS grid classes within the main container.
nodes.agent_prompt: Using Tailwind CSS grid classes, divide the main container into a 3-column layout. The left column should take up 20% of the width, the center column 50%, and the right column 30%. Ensure the layout is responsive and adjusts appropriately for different screen sizes using Tailwind's responsive prefixes (e.g., sm:, md:, lg:). Pass the entire HTML file from the previous step as input. Use the output of previous step in the prompt.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to update the index.html file to include a 3-column grid layout using Tailwind CSS. The layout should be responsive, adjusting for different screen sizes. I will use the grid classes and responsive prefixes to achieve this. I'll use the HTML content from the previous step as a starting point and modify the container div to create the grid. I will also wrap the existing content inside the middle column for now.

nodes.description: Build the left navigation menu with a dark background, vertical menu items (Personal Information, Work Experience, Education, Skills, Certifications, Templates), icons, and text using Flowbite list group component.
nodes.agent_prompt: Inside the left column, create a vertical navigation menu with a dark background. Use Flowbite's list group component to create menu items for 'Personal Information', 'Work Experience', 'Education', 'Skills', 'Certifications', and 'Templates'. Include relevant icons for each menu item (you can use Font Awesome or similar CDN-based icon library). Ensure the menu items are properly styled and aligned. Add a progress bar at the top of the column, with hardcoded 20% progress. Add 'Export as PDF' and 'Reset Form' buttons at the bottom of the column with proper Flowbite styling. Pass the entire HTML file from the previous step as input. Use the output of previous step in the prompt.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to update the `index.html` file by adding the vertical navigation menu, progress bar, and buttons in the left column. I'll use Flowbite's list group component for the menu items and include Font Awesome icons. I will also add a progress bar with a hardcoded 20% progress and 'Export as PDF' and 'Reset Form' buttons at the bottom of the column. I will use Tailwind CSS classes for styling and alignment. I'll update the existing HTML structure from the previous step.

nodes.agent_prompt: Generate the final HTML report with all the implemented functionalities and styling, which is a responsive, professional single-page CV Builder using Tailwind CSS + Flowbite via CDN (no build tools) in pure HTML/CSS/JS, with a 3-column layout. The theme is black and white, with a beautiful sans-serif font like DM Sans or Inter. The PDF export, form reset, and section navigation work with minimal JS. The layout is mobile/tablet responsive using Tailwind utilities.
Summarize the code and process for building this CV builder. Highlight the key steps and technologies used.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to summarize the process of building the CV builder based on the provided HTML report. I will focus on the key steps, technologies used, and the overall architecture.

summary_bullets: The CV Builder is a responsive, single-page application built using HTML, CSS (Tailwind CSS + Flowbite), and JavaScript.
The application features a 3-column layout: a vertical menu on the left, interactive form sections in the center, and a live CV preview on the right.
Key technologies used include HTML for structure, Tailwind CSS and Flowbite for styling, and JavaScript for interactive features.
The left column provides navigation between sections like Personal Information, Work Experience, Education, Skills, and Templates.
The center column displays the active form section, styled with Flowbite components.
The right column offers a live CV preview that updates in real-time as the user inputs data.
The application is designed to be mobile and tablet responsive.
PDF export and form reset functionalities are implemented using JavaScript.
